items.title: Nifty Pharma extends losses for a fifth session as generics players fret over tariff deadline
items.description: Currently, US charges nearly zero duty on pharmaceutical imports, while India imposes around 10 percent tax on pharma imports from US. Domestic pharma companies are fearful of any potential impact due to Trump's reciprocal tariffs.

items.title: Sensex plunges 1,400 pts, Nifty slips below 23,200 as IT, bank stocks tumble ahead of April 2 tariff deadline
items.description: Fear gripped the Street as India VIX, a key gauge of market volatility, surged 9 percent to 14 levels.

items.title: Relief for Voda Idea: Brokerages welcome 'material positive', 'lifeline' by Centre with bullish calls
items.description: Ambit Capital kept a 'Buy' rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 15 per share. This implies an upside potential of over 120 percent from the stock’s previous closing price.

items.title: HBL Engineering shares soar 12% after bagging five 'Kavach' contracts worth Rs 763 crore
items.description: HBL Engineering has bagged five contracts related to provision of Kavach systems, with a total value of Rs 762.56 crore, encompassing 413 stations, and covering 3,900 km of land. Each of the contracts are scheduled to be completed in 18 months.

items.title: Buy Hindware Home Innovation; target of Rs 253: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Hindware Home Innovation has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 253 in its research report dated April 01, 2025.

items.title: Gas stocks in focus as govt hikes APM gas prices by 4%
items.description: Jefferies anticipates a positive impact on ONGC's EPS, with a projected 14% CAGR from FY25 to FY27

items.title: Buy Ashok Leyland; target of Rs 260: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Ashok Leyland has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 260 in its research report dated April 01, 2025.

items.title: Hold TATA Elxsi; target of Rs 4900: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking recommended hold rating on TATA Elxsi with a target price of Rs 4900 in its research report dated April 01, 2025.

items.title: Selloff deepens: Sensex, Nifty extend losses, slip over 1% as Trump's tariff decision looms
items.description: The broader market segment, which initially showed resilience, eventually lost steam and turned red

items.title: Prashant Jain on navigating market challenges and spotting the next big opportunity | Wealth Formula
items.description: Prashant Jain, CIO and founder, 3P Investment Managers is a a market veteran with more than 35 years of experience in markets. He sits down with Moneycontrol's N Mahalakshmi to discuss market corrections, valuations concerns in the Small- and mid-cap space, and how "Patience" and "Prudence" play a role in his investing philosophy.

items.title: V2 Retail: Will this fashion retailer deliver value to investors?
items.description: The company is positioning itself as a key player in India’s value retail sector.

items.title: Agri Picks Report April 01, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of rabi crops in Telangana was at 7.5 million acres (1 acre = 0.4 hectares) as of Wednesday, up 12.7% from 6.7 million acres sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Will the steady rise in demand for domestic natural gas propel this stock?
items.description: GAIL looks to have financial headroom to execute energy infrastructure projects

items.title: ITC shares flat, Aditya Birla Real Estate stock up 3% as ITC acquires Century Pulp and Paper
items.description: ITC said the acquisition of Century Pulp and Paper is in line with its strategy to drive the next phase of growth in its Paperboards and Specialty Papers Business.

items.title: Vodafone Idea shares jump 20% as government converts Rs 36,950 crore dues into equity
items.description: The Government of India's shareholding in Vodafone Idea will increase from 22.6 percent to 48.99 percent following the conversion of dues into shares worth Rs 36,950 crore.

items.title: RITES shares gain 3% on contracts win worth Rs 312.75 crore
items.description: RITES Share Price | The company received letter of award (LoA) from Oil India (OIL) of Rs 157.25 crore for construction of workmen housing complex (BQ Area) at OIL, Duliajan on turnkey basis under depository works mode, to be completed in 36 months.

items.title: Hindustan Aeronautics shares rise 6% after Defence Ministry signs 2 contracts worth Rs 62,700 crore
items.description: Hindustan Aeronautics Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 5,675.00 and a 52-week low of Rs 3,045.95 on 09 July, 2024 and 03 March, 2025, respectively.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex down 1400 pts, Nifty at 23,150; HCL Tech, Bajaj Finserv, Infosys top losers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: HCL Technologies, Bajaj Finserv, HDFC Bank, Infosys, Hindalco Industries are among major losers on the Nifty, while gainers are IndusInd Bank, Trent, Bajaj Auto, Jio Financial, HDFC Life. BSE Midcap index down 0.9 percent and smallcap index is up 0.2 percent. Except media, oil & gas, telecom, all other indices are trading in the red IT, realty, consumer durables down 2 percent each.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: After witnessing buying in the previous six sessions, the Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) remained net sellers on March 28 as they sold equities worth Rs 4352 crore. On the other hand, Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) continued their buying on second days as they purchased equities of Rs 7646 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Asian shares rise, futures drop as tariffs near
items.description: While Asian shares rose for the first time in four days, US equity-index futures declined, showing markets remain under pressure.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Fortis Healthcare, Sumitomo Chemical, Ramco Cements, HDFC Life, Hindustan Zinc, and others on April 1?
items.description: The market is expected to consolidate further amid caution ahead of tariffs announcements by Donald Trump. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Auto sales roundup: M&M, Bajaj, TVS clock strong March, Tata and Maruti under pressure
items.description: Tata Motors reported a muted sales growth in March, while M&M clocked strong monthly sales, and Maruti Suzuki's total sales grew marginally on year. Eicher Motors, the maker of Royal Enfield, recorded a sale of one lakh motorcycles in March, marking a 34 percent on-year rise.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on April 1
items.description: Investor worries remain heightened ahead of US President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs which are set to take effect from April 2.

items.title: Taking Stock: Nifty below 23,200, Sensex plunges 1,390 points; media, telecom outperform
items.description: Except media (up 2 percent), oil & gas (up 0.6 percent), telecom (up 2 percent), all other indices ended in the red with IT, realty, consumer durables shed 2-3 percent each.

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty slip over 1% ahead of Trump's tariff plans | Closing Bell
items.description: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex extended their slide on April 1, with investors on edge ahead of U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff deadline. Nifty IT and Pharma—most exposed to potential trade shocks—led the sell-off, followed by financial stocks. Meanwhile, fear gripped the Street as India VIX, a key gauge of market volatility, surged 9 percent to 14 levels. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Trading uninterrupted! If BSE goes down, trade on NSE, and vice versa
items.description: NSE and BSE to act as backups for each other in case of major outage from today.

items.title: Buy Hindustan Aeronautics; target of Rs 5000: Choice Equity Broking
items.description: Choice Equity Broking is bullish on Hindustan Aeronautics has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 5000 in its research report dated April 01, 2025.

items.title: Dow Jones opens lower, Nasdaq Composite, S&P500 rise ahead of Trump tariff deadline
items.description: Market volatility remained elevated, with the CBOE Volatility Index, often called Wall Street’s fear gauge, hovering around 23.

items.title: Bulk & Block deals: ICICI Prudential purchases nearly 6 lakh shares of Galaxy Surfactants on April 1
items.description: Kesoram Industries saw Ishaan Tradefin LLP offload 20.31 lakh shares at an average price of Rs 3.98, according to exchange data.

items.title: FII net sell shares worth Rs 5,901 crore, DIIs net buyers of Rs 4,322 crore
items.description: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex extended their slide on April 1, with investors on edge ahead of former U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff deadline. Nifty IT and Pharma—most exposed to potential trade shocks—led the sell-off.

items.title: Hyundai Motor India's March sales rise over 2%, SUVs dominate portfolio
items.description: SUVs accounted for 68.5 percent of Hyundai’s domestic sales in FY25. The CRETA remained a strong performer, with 52,898 units sold in Q4 FY25.

items.title: Wockhardt Zaynich succeeds in third compassionate use, shares rise while tariff talk keeps pharma subdued
items.description: Investigational antibiotic 'Zaynich' was successful in curing a severe drug-resistant infection in a 15-year old cancer patient in US.
